snippet: General Motors executives attributed the decline partly to a decision to reduce sales to rental fleets. Buick, Chevrolet and Cadillac suffered losses.
abstract: Autodata Corporation reports carmakers sold more than 8.5 million vehicles in United States in first six months of 2015, up 3.9 percent from year-ago first-half; seasonally adjusted average rate rose to 17.16 million, highest June number since 2006.
lead_paragraph: General Motors executives attributed the decline partly to a decision to reduce sales to rental fleets. Buick, Chevrolet and Cadillac suffered losses.

headline.main: Amid Strong 1st Half for Auto Sales, G.M. Saw 3% Drop in June
headline.print_headline: Strong 1st Half for Auto Sales, and Outlook Is Bright
